question.text: Which tissue is not correctly related to its fate during the secondary growth?

options.text:
Tissue Fate during secondary growth
Secondary xylem Produced in high amount

Tissue Fate during secondary growth
Primary phloem Produced in low amount

Tissue Fate during secondary growth
Cambial ring Cut off secondary permanent tissue on both side

Tissue Fate during secondary growth
Secondary phloem Synthesized on outer side

solution.text:
Mechanism in secondary growth in vascular region of dicot stem

1. Vascular cambium (intrafscicular cambium) alongwith interfascicular cambium forms a continuous ring of cambium.

2. Cambial ring becomes active and cut off secondary phloem towards outer side and secondary xylem towards inner side.

3. Secondary xylem is produced more in quantity as cambium is more active in its inner part.

4. When secondary growth repeats few more times, high amount of secondary xylem is accumulates which results in crushing of the primary phloem and most of the secondary phloem (although primary xylem may remain intact).

5. Cambium forms narrow bands of secondary phloem at some places which are termed as medullary rays.

6. Girth of plant increases.
